greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,p) (n >= 2, 1 <= p <= n-1) = number of compositions of n into p parts, with first part >= all other parts.
comment: This triangle arose in connection with a problem involving "lunar arithmetic".
Take the triangle formed by the antidiagonals of A156041 and reverse each row.
link: D. Applegate, M. LeBrun and N. J. A. Sloane, Dismal Arithmetic [Note: we have now changed the name from "dismal arithmetic" to "lunar arithmetic" - the old name was too depressing]
Index entries for sequences related to dismal (or lunar) arithmetic
xref: Cf. A156041. This is also A184957 with the last diagonal omitted.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 26 2011
